org.framed.orm.ui.command

Class StepCommand

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.gef.commands.Command
      • org.framed.orm.ui.command.StepCommand

  • public class StepCommand
extends org.eclipse.gef.commands.Command
    This command realize the step in/out, which is initialized by the StepInAction, the StepInNewPageAction, the StepInNewTabAction or the StepOutAction, through changing the content of the viewer of the ORMMultiPageEditor instance, which owns the Compartment or the Grouping the user wants to step in/out.
    Author:
    Kay Bierzynski

      • canExecute

        public boolean canExecute()
        This method tests if the conditions for executing this command are fulfilled,
        Overrides:
        canExecute in class org.eclipse.gef.commands.Command
        Returns:
        true if the parameters editpart, editorPart and newContent is set.

      • execute

        public void execute()
        The first thing that is done in this method is that a new editor page is opened when this command is called/requested by StepInNewPageAction or that the method gets the active editor page in any other case. After that a new ORMMultiPageEditor instance is created, the initial viewer content of the new ORMMultiPageEditor instance is replaced with the newContent, a custom title based on the newContent which is shown in the tab is created for the new editor instance and the editortype of the childeditors is updated to adjust what is accessible in the editor pallet. All this is done in the case that this command was called/requested by the StepInNewPageAction or the StepInNewTabAction the initial viewer content. In any other case all thing which where listed for a new ORMMultiPageEditor instance are done for the active ORMMultiPageEditor instance.
        Overrides:
        execute in class org.eclipse.gef.commands.Command

      • canUndo

        public boolean canUndo()
        Method, which determines if the the command can be undone or not.
        Overrides:
        canUndo in class org.eclipse.gef.commands.Command
        Returns:
        false this command can never be undone, because the change of the viewer should always happen through step actions also through context menu or shortcut
